title: RDP Sessions fail after opening like 8 or 10 sessions. have to close MRemoteNG in order to be able to connect again
author: ptfxnz
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

I am using the PREVIEW version 1.77.1.27713 and i noticed that after i have opened around 8 to 10 RDP sessions, if i try to open another RDP session, it fails. in order to be able to connect using RDP again i have to close MRemoteNG and then RDP starts to work again.

Thank you.

comments.author: darkpixel

comments.snippet:
I tested using the stable version and ran into the same issue.  I then upgraded to the nightly build and it seems to work.
I'm not sure why some of our users are suddenly affected by it while others aren't.  They all run the same desktop hardware and software, and we haven't made any changes to our server environments.  If I had to guess, it's a Windows Update lurking somewhere that broke things for some Windows 10 workstations.
comments.author: darkpixel

comments.snippet: Are you running into a memory limitation?
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
There is plenty of free memory on the servers, and my test workstation has 128 GB RAM. ;)

One of our techs while troubleshooting mentioned a message in mRemote about memory but when checking the workstation there was plenty free.

The issue started this morning after a round of Windows Updates were deployed last night, so I'm suspecting Microsoft messed something up....regardless, the mRemote nightly build doesn't seem to suffer from the issue...but I will admit we haven't done a lot of tes...
comments.author: darkpixel

comments.snippet: The nightly build fixed the issue for the user that was having problems.
comments.author: darkpixel

comments.snippet:
mRemoteNG versions before 1.77.2 were 32bit (x86), which limits the usable memory to 4 GB. Depending on the screen resolution you used the RDP sessions consumed all memory available and you could not start additional sessions. (Run into a similar issue though with a higher number of connections).

I assume this is the same thing as with issue #1715, #854, #864 and #910, which all got solved with the x64 Build of this Software (see #915).
